New Records: Cody Bellinger hit his 14th home run of the season.
The Chicago Cubs improved to 6-1 on their three-city road trip.
Dylan Crews homered for the second consecutive game.
Key Match Events: The Cubs scored seven runs in the second inning, highlighted by Cody Bellinger's two-run home run.
The game was closely contested, ending with a 7-6 victory for the Cubs.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs had a strong performance in their previous games, especially with five-run innings.
Shota Imanaga, the Cubs' starter, allowed three runs and struck out eight in six innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Chicago Cubs manager Craig Counsell praised the team's performance in the second inning.
Washington Nationals manager Dave Martinez highlighted the effectiveness of Jake Irvin when he kept the ball down.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs had at least one five-run inning in each of their three victories in Pittsburgh this week.
The article mentioned updates on injured players, including Trevor Williams and Derek Law.
Others: The game was the opener of a three-game series between the Cubs and the Nationals.
